Text:
Zeta returns to the Shadow Garden's hideout after
completing her mission, only to find Cid there.
Huh? Master Shadow?
Oh, welcome back, Zeta.

Thank you, my lord. It's rare to see you on your own.
Is no one here today?
Who knows? No one was here when I got here. *munch*
With that reply, Cid takes a bite of a tuna sandwich.
Oh...I see.

(If someone were at the hideout, I doubt they'd miss
an opportunity to talk to Master Shadow. In that
case—)
With graceful movement, Zeta sits down next to Cid.
What are you plans for today, my lord?
Hm? Nothing in particular.

Then...why don't you come into town with me? I have
some errands to run and a mission debriefing.
Sure.

B-Besides, seeing you eat that sandwich is making me
hungry as well—
What?! Really?!
(I-I thought he'd say no...)
R-Really?
Hm? Wait, were you kidding?
No, no! I'm serious! Really!
I-I'll quickly get ready, so sit tight for a second!
Okey-dokey.

She'll make this casual overture only to reveal
crucial intel. Hmm. That's some well-played spying.

She seems to have some sort of scene in mind. Guess I
can assist in bringing out the best in her today.
Yeah, I'll play along.

Zeta, having changed into casual wear, arrives in
town with Cid.

That cafe there offers a variety of pasta dishes and
is popular among young women. And the one with
terrace seating there sells cakes.

Wow, I never paid much attention since I always walk
down this way. You sure know a lot about it, Zeta.
Well, I am a spy after all. Heheh!

Oh, the store across the alley sells questionable
antiques, but you can sometimes find great bargains.
That said, more than half of what they sell are
fakes.

I see. Guess it's better than everything they sell
being fakes.

Agreed. Just be careful when you pick up something
that draws you in visually. Fakes are often more
elaborately decorated to catch people's attention.

Because they're made to cater psychologically to the
people who buy them?
Yes, that's right! Impressive as always, my lord!
How were you able to spot them, Zeta?

Oh, well, after seeing the same items everywhere I go
and being told, "You can only find this here!" you
start to catch on.
I see. That's a very "you" way of figuring it out.

Well, it just takes a bit of observation, right?
Next...I want to go that way.
There's some sort of line. Is that...a book signing?
Judging by that magic wavelength...it's Beta.

Wow, you can tell from this distance? Guess that's
why Beta wasn't home today.

There she goes, getting popular over another
plagiarized work...
Hm? Did you say something?

No, it's nothing. Anyway, it looks like she's working
hard, so let's drop by and say hi—

Zeta uses her tail to catch Cid's eye while her hands
drag him away.
I'd prefer if we spent today with just the two of us.
Huh? Oh, yeah. Sure...

L-Look! That's where I wanted to take you! The new
Tuna King!

Zeta doesn't meet Cid's gaze until they leave Tuna
King.

Zeta says she wants the food to go, and after
ordering it, the two return to the hideout.
*munch munch*
Hahah! You sure eat a lot.
It's my favorite. This new one isn't half bad either.
Heheh. Guess your appetite is extraordinary as well.
Hm, Zeta...

Cid stops eating and gazes at Zeta's face silently
for a moment.
Wh-What's wrong? D-Do I have something on my face?
I feel like you're more cheerful than you used to be.
Cheerful... Me?
Yeah.

And you've matured. I didn't see you for a while, so
I feel like you're suddenly all grown up. You were
just a runt until recently...
What do you mean "recently"?
Uh...around the time we first met?

That was over two years ago already. So of course
I've matured. I'm all grown-up now.

But I know I look more mature than my actual age.
My mother was the same. I often see the resemblance
when I look in the mirror, so I guess it's genetic.
And my mother was an exceptional beauty, you know?
Yeah? Interesting.

It really comes in handy during missions. In terms of
physique, it's far more convenient to be seen as an
adult.
...You know, for various reasons.

Zeta says this suggestively, in a bewitching voice.
She leans toward Cid and touches her hand to his lips.
You had sauce on your face.
Oh, thanks.
You don't get flustered at all, my lord.
Hm? Why should I?
No, never mind.
Oh, you know how you said I'm more cheerful?
Yeah.
That's thanks to you...you know, my lord?

Hmm, I don't recall doing anything in particular,
but...glad to hear that.

Oh, it's almost my dorm curfew. I've got to get back
since I have a public image to maintain. See ya
later.
Cid leaves the scene with blinding speed.
There he goes.
Thank you for today, my lord.

Zeta gives a satisfied smile as she gazes at where
Cid had been.
